presenter.bio: EUS-FNA of Hepatic Lesions: Technique & Limitation

slide.title: EUS-FNA of Hepatic Lesions: Technique & Limitation
slide.titleNormalized: eus-fna of hepatic lesions: technique & limitation
slide.notes: Thank you chairman for your kind introduction. It’s my great honor to be here.
slide.notesNormalized: thank you chairman for your kind introduction. it’s my great honor to be here.
slide.notesHtml: Thank you chairman for your kind introduction. It’s my great honor to be here.
slide.text:
EUS-FNA of Hepatic Lesions: Technique & Limitation Hyun J. Choi, MD, PhD
Department of Internal Medicine Soon Chun Hyang University School of Medicine Bucheon/Seoul, KOREA Asian EUS Summit 2016 Session 5. EUS-Guided Tissue Acquisition

slide.title: Endoscopic Ultrasonography (EUS)
slide.notes: EUS is deyond endoscopy. It provides real-time scanning with
slide.notesNormalized: eus is deyond endoscopy. it provides real-time scanning with
slide.notesHtml: EUS is deyond endoscopy. It provides real-time scanning with
slide.text: Endoscopic Ultrasonography (EUS) DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Beyond endoscopy Real-time scanning with high resolution US images for GI wall and adjacent organs, especially pancreas and hepatobiliary system Usage of EUS has been expanded from diagnostic to therapeutic interventions Operator dependent

slide.title: EUS-Guided Fine Needle Aspiration (FNA)
slide.text: EUS-Guided Fine Needle Aspiration (FNA) DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Tissue sampling for cytologic and/or histologic evaluation Acceptable safety with limited adverse events Rapid on-site evaluation by cytopathologist High diagnostic performance Most lesions that can be depicted by EUS can be the target for FNA

slide.title: EUS-Guided FNA for Hepatic Lesions
slide.text: EUS-Guided FNA for Hepatic Lesions DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Not different with lesions of other organs Not sufficient data in comparing with EUS-FNA for pancreatic lesions Good results in several studies and series Acceptable safety Limitation to the location, especially hepatic dome and right posterior / inferior segments

slide.title: EUS-Guided FNA for Hepatic Lesions
slide.notes: EUS-guided FNA for hepatic lesions was reported in 1999. Authors performed EUS-FNA for 15 hepatic lesions of 14 patients. 22G needle was used, and the mean number of needle pass was two. They reported good diagnostic results. Interestingly, they found another hepatic lesions in 11 patients during EUS evaluation that was not detected in previous CT scan.
slide.notesNormalized: eus-guided fna for hepatic lesions was reported in 1999. authors performed eus-fna for 15 hepatic lesions of 14 patients. 22g needle was used, and the mean number of needle pass was two. they reported good diagnostic results. interestingly, they found another hepatic lesions in 11 patients during eus evaluation that was not detected in previous ct scan.
slide.notesHtml:
EUS-guided FNA for hepatic lesions was reported in 1999. Authors performed EUS-FNA for 15 hepatic lesions of 14 patients.

22G needle was used, and the mean number of needle pass was two.

They reported good diagnostic results.

Interestingly, they found another hepatic lesions in 11 patients during EUS evaluation that was not detected in previous CT scan.
slide.text: EUS-Guided FNA for Hepatic Lesions DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL 15 hepatic lesions of 14 patients with suspected GI or pulmonary malignancy (5 right lobe, 9 left) Hepatic lesions of 11 patients: not detected in CT Mean diameter: 1.1 cm (range 0.8 – 5.2) 22G needle, mean 2 passes (1 – 5) Accuracy: 100% (15/15) Nguyen P, et al. Gastrointest Endosc 1999;50:357

slide.title: EUS-Guided FNA for Hepatic Lesions
slide.notes: There are several another reports about EUS-FNA for hepatic lesions. They also reported good diagnostic performance with limited adverse events.
slide.notesNormalized: there are several another reports about eus-fna for hepatic lesions. they also reported good diagnostic performance with limited adverse events.
slide.notesHtml:
There are several another reports about EUS-FNA for hepatic lesions.

They also reported good diagnostic performance with limited adverse events.
slide.text: EUS-Guided FNA for Hepatic Lesions DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL tenBerge J, et al. Gastrointest Endosc 2002;55:859 DeWitt J, et al. Am J Gastroenterol 2003;98:1976 Hollerbach S, et al. Endoscopy 2003;35:743 Studies n Lt/Rt Diagnostics Adverse for malignancy events 2002 tenBerge et al. 167 NA 83% (138/167) 4% (6/167) 2003 DeWitt et al. 77 66/11 82-94%* 0% 2003 Hollerbach et al. 41 NA 94% (31/33) 5% (2/41) Lt/Rt, left lobe or right lobe; NA, not available *Sensitivity for malignancy depending on the status of 7 unclassified lesions

slide.title: EUS-Guided FNA for Hepatic Lesions
slide.notes:
886680 임태순
The lesion of left hepatic lobe can be easily accessible from upper stomach. And the technique of FNA is same with FNA for other organs. To-and-pro movements, door-knocking method, fanning technique, using stylet or not, and with suction or not.
slide.notesNormalized:
886680 임태순
the lesion of left hepatic lobe can be easily accessible from upper stomach. and the technique of fna is same with fna for other organs. to-and-pro movements, door-knocking method, fanning technique, using stylet or not, and with suction or not.
slide.notesHtml:
886680 임태순

The lesion of left hepatic lobe can be easily accessible from upper stomach.

And the technique of FNA is same with FNA for other organs.

To-and-pro movements, door-knocking method, fanning technique, using stylet or not, and with suction or not.
slide.text: EUS-Guided FNA for Hepatic Lesions 76 years old male Pancreatic tail cancer with liver metastasis

slide.title: Percutaneous Liver Biopsy
slide.notes: Percutaneous liver biopsy is the gold standard method for histopathological evaluation of solid liver masses. However, there are limitation for selected patients and rare but serious complications.
slide.notesNormalized: percutaneous liver biopsy is the gold standard method for histopathological evaluation of solid liver masses. however, there are limitation for selected patients and rare but serious complications.
slide.notesHtml:
Percutaneous liver biopsy is the gold standard method for histopathological evaluation of solid liver masses.

However, there are limitation for selected patients and rare but serious complications.
slide.text: Percutaneous Liver Biopsy DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Gold standard for histopathological evaluation of solid liver masses Limited in some conditions Inability to identify an adequate biopsy site Ascites Morbid obesity Rare but serious complications Pain, bleeding, implantation metastasis, puncture of another organ Bravo AA, et al. N Engl J Med 2001;344:495

slide.title: EUS-Guided Sampling as Percutaneous Biopsy Rescue for Solid Liver Mass
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided sampling as percutaneous biopsy rescue for solid liver mass
slide.notes: We evaluated the usefulness of EUS-FNA as percutaneous biopsy rescue for solid liver masses. We performed EUS-FNA in 21 patients with failure to diagnosis or poor accessibility by percutaneous liver biopsy.
slide.notesNormalized: we evaluated the usefulness of eus-fna as percutaneous biopsy rescue for solid liver masses. we performed eus-fna in 21 patients with failure to diagnosis or poor accessibility by percutaneous liver biopsy.
slide.notesHtml:
We evaluated the usefulness of EUS-FNA as percutaneous biopsy rescue for solid liver masses.

We performed EUS-FNA in 21 patients with failure to diagnosis or poor accessibility by percutaneous liver biopsy.
slide.text: EUS-Guided Sampling as Percutaneous Biopsy Rescue for Solid Liver Mass DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Lee YN, et al. J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2015;30:1161 Solid liver masses (n=245) Failure to diagnosis or poor accessibility by percutaneous liver biopsy (n=29) EUS-guided FNA (n=21) Poor accessibility by EUS, or disagree to study (n=8)

slide.title: Poor Accessible by Percutaneous Approach
slide.notes:
712806 고금순
For the left hepatic lesion that was poorly accessible by percutaneous approach, EUS-FNA was performed.
slide.notesNormalized:
712806 고금순
for the left hepatic lesion that was poorly accessible by percutaneous approach, eus-fna was performed.
slide.notesHtml:
712806 고금순

For the left hepatic lesion that was poorly accessible by percutaneous approach, EUS-FNA was performed.
slide.text: Poor Accessible by Percutaneous Approach

slide.title: Triple Sample Preparation for One Pass
slide.titleNormalized: triple sample preparation for one pass
slide.notes: This is our sample preparation protocol for one needle pass. The specimen was divided to three portion, on-site analysis with Giemasa stain, cytologic analysis with PAP stain, and histologic analysis with H&E stain and immunohistochemical stain.
slide.notesNormalized: this is our sample preparation protocol for one needle pass. the specimen was divided to three portion, on-site analysis with giemasa stain, cytologic analysis with pap stain, and histologic analysis with h&e stain and immunohistochemical stain.
slide.notesHtml:
This is our sample preparation protocol for one needle pass.

The specimen was divided to three portion, on-site analysis with Giemasa stain, cytologic analysis with PAP stain, and histologic analysis with H&E stain and immunohistochemical stain.
slide.text: Triple Sample Preparation for One Pass DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Lee YN, et al. J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2015;30:1161 On-site analysis Diff-Quick (Giemsa stain) Cytologic analysis Papanicolaou stain Histologic analysis H & E stain with IHC* *IHC, immunohistochemical stain

slide.title: Triple Evaluation
slide.notes:
712806 고금순
Malignance cells are detected by on-site and cytologic analysis, and adenocarcinoma was diagnosed in histologic analysis.
slide.notesNormalized:
712806 고금순
malignance cells are detected by on-site and cytologic analysis, and adenocarcinoma was diagnosed in histologic analysis.
slide.notesHtml:
712806 고금순

Malignance cells are detected by on-site and cytologic analysis, and adenocarcinoma was diagnosed in histologic analysis.
slide.text: Triple Evaluation On-site analysis, Diff-Quick (Giemsa stain) Cytologic analysis, Papanicolaou stain Histologic analysis, H&E stain

slide.title: Immunohistochemical Stain
slide.notes:
712806 고금순
After immunohistochemical stain, the final diagnosis was cholangiocarcinoma.
slide.notesNormalized:
712806 고금순
after immunohistochemical stain, the final diagnosis was cholangiocarcinoma.
slide.notesHtml:

After immunohistochemical stain, the final diagnosis was cholangiocarcinoma.
slide.text: Immunohistochemical Stain CK 19 (+) Hepatocyte (-) Intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma

slide.title: EUS-Guided Sampling as Percutaneous Biopsy Rescue for Solid Liver Mass (n=21)
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided sampling as percutaneous biopsy rescue for solid liver mass (n=21)
slide.notes:
These are study results.
All lesions are located in the left hepatic lobe. The mean size of the lesion was 29 mm. And final diagnosis were like these.

these are study results.
all lesions are located in the left hepatic lobe. the mean size of the lesion was 29 mm. and final diagnosis were like these.

slide.text: EUS-Guided Sampling as Percutaneous Biopsy Rescue for Solid Liver Mass (n=21) DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Lee YN, et al. J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2015;30:1161 Tumor location, n Left lobe 21 S1/S2/S3/S4 2/8/10/1 Right lobe 0 Size of the tumor, mm, n (%) Mean ± SD (range) 29.0 ± 5.9 (14-38) < 20 2 (9.5) 20-30 8 (38.1) > 30 11 (52.4) Final diagnosis, n (%) Primary liver mass 11 (52.4) Hepatocellular carcinoma 3 Intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma 7 Neuroendocrine tumor 1 Metastatic liver mass 10 (47.6)

slide.title: EUS-Guided Sampling as Percutaneous Biopsy Rescue for Solid Liver Mass (n=21)
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided sampling as percutaneous biopsy rescue for solid liver mass (n=21)
slide.notes: The mean number of needle passes for adequate diagnosis was 2.1 22G needle was used in most cases. The adequacy for cytohistologic evaluation were 85 to 90% There are no significant adverse events.
slide.notesNormalized: the mean number of needle passes for adequate diagnosis was 2.1 22g needle was used in most cases. the adequacy for cytohistologic evaluation were 85 to 90% there are no significant adverse events.
slide.notesHtml:
The mean number of needle passes for adequate diagnosis was 2.1

22G needle was used in most cases.

The adequacy for cytohistologic evaluation were 85 to 90%

There are no significant adverse events.
slide.text: EUS-Guided Sampling as Percutaneous Biopsy Rescue for Solid Liver Mass (n=21) DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Lee YN, et al. J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2015;30:1161 Number of needle passes for diagnosis Mean (SD) 2.1 (0.81) Median (range) 2.0 (1-5) Interquartile range 1.0-2.0 Needle gauge (G), n (%) 22G 20 (95.2) 25G 1 (4.8) Technical success, n (%) 21 (100) Adequate specimen, n (%) On-site cytology 19 (90.5) Cytology with Papanicolaou stain 18 (85.7) Histology with HE stain 19 (90.5) Histology with IHC stain 19 (90.5) Adverse events, n 0

slide.title: EUS-Guided Sampling as Percutaneous Biopsy Rescue for Solid Liver Mass (n=21)
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided sampling as percutaneous biopsy rescue for solid liver mass (n=21)
slide.notes: The sensitivity for malignancy were 76% by on-site cytology, 81% by cytology with PAP stain, and 90% by histologic evaluation. The overall diagnostic accuracy of EUS-FNA was 90.5%.
slide.notesNormalized: the sensitivity for malignancy were 76% by on-site cytology, 81% by cytology with pap stain, and 90% by histologic evaluation. the overall diagnostic accuracy of eus-fna was 90.5%.
slide.notesHtml:
The sensitivity for malignancy were 76% by on-site cytology, 81% by cytology with PAP stain, and 90% by histologic evaluation.

The overall diagnostic accuracy of EUS-FNA was 90.5%.
slide.text: EUS-Guided Sampling as Percutaneous Biopsy Rescue for Solid Liver Mass (n=21) DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Lee YN, et al. J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2015;30:1161 Positive for malignancy, n (%) On-site cytology 16 (76.2) Cytology with papanicolaou stain 17 (81.0) Histology using HE stain 19 (90.5) Diagnostic accuracy for malignancy (%) 90.5 (95% confidence interval) (77.9-100) Diagnostic accuracy for specific tumor type (%) 85.7 (95% confidence interval) (70.6-100)

slide.title: EUS-FNA for Hepatic Lesions
slide.notes: For left hepatic lesions, EUS-FNA can be easily performed from upper stomach. And 22G needle is preferred. However, there are limitation for right hepatic lesions. Those are usually accessible from gastric antrum or duodenal bulb.
slide.notesNormalized: for left hepatic lesions, eus-fna can be easily performed from upper stomach. and 22g needle is preferred. however, there are limitation for right hepatic lesions. those are usually accessible from gastric antrum or duodenal bulb.
slide.notesHtml:
For left hepatic lesions, EUS-FNA can be easily performed from upper stomach. And 22G needle is preferred.

However, there are limitation for right hepatic lesions. Those are usually accessible from gastric antrum or duodenal bulb.
slide.text: EUS-FNA for Hepatic Lesions DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL For the left lobe Easy, transgastric puncture 22G needle preferred For the right lobe Limited, transgastric (antrum) or transduodenal puncture 25G or 22G needle Technique of FNA is same with FNA for pancreatic lesions (stylet, with suction, etc)

slide.title: Contrast-Enhanced Harmonic EUS
slide.notes:
I would like to talk about one more thing.
Contrast-enhanced EUS allows to obtain perfusion images from microbubbles of specific contrast agent. It is useful in the characterization and differential diagnosis of specific lesions.
slide.notesNormalized:
i would like to talk about one more thing.
contrast-enhanced eus allows to obtain perfusion images from microbubbles of specific contrast agent. it is useful in the characterization and differential diagnosis of specific lesions.
slide.notesHtml:
I would like to talk about one more thing.

Contrast-enhanced EUS allows to obtain perfusion images from microbubbles of specific contrast agent.

It is useful in the characterization and differential diagnosis of specific lesions.
slide.text: Contrast-Enhanced Harmonic EUS DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Obtain perfusion images from microbubbles of specific contrast agent Allows parenchymal perfusion to be visualized in real-time Useful in the characterization and differential diagnosis of specific lesions Sonazoid® has postvascular phase (Kupper phase) and is useful for hepatic lesions

slide.title: Contrast-Enhanced EUS
slide.notes:
1081893 이연림
After contrast enhancement, the lesion is revealed as a hypoenhanced lesion with peripheral enhancement. So the lesion is more defined. However, this image is not so clear.
slide.notesNormalized:
1081893 이연림
after contrast enhancement, the lesion is revealed as a hypoenhanced lesion with peripheral enhancement. so the lesion is more defined. however, this image is not so clear.

1081893 이연림

After contrast enhancement, the lesion is revealed as a hypoenhanced lesion with peripheral enhancement.

So the lesion is more defined. However, this image is not so clear.
slide.text: Contrast-Enhanced EUS

slide.title: CE-EUS in Tissue Harmonic Echo (THE) Mode
slide.titleNormalized: ce-eus in tissue harmonic echo (the) mode
slide.notes: The Tissue Harmonic Echo mode is dedicated US mode to reduce articfacts and allow imaging of fine structure. Dr. Kitano suggested CE-EUS in Tissue Harmonic Echo mode.
slide.notesNormalized: the tissue harmonic echo mode is dedicated us mode to reduce articfacts and allow imaging of fine structure. dr. kitano suggested ce-eus in tissue harmonic echo mode.
slide.notesHtml:
The Tissue Harmonic Echo mode is dedicated US mode to reduce articfacts and allow imaging of fine structure.

Dr. Kitano suggested CE-EUS in Tissue Harmonic Echo mode.
slide.text: CE-EUS in Tissue Harmonic Echo (THE) Mode DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL Reduce artifacts by image signal processing May allow imaging of fine structure by reducing artifacts Low mechanical index is need to obtain signals from microbubbles from parenchymal perfusion Single image mode Masayuki Kitano

slide.title: CE-EUS in THE Mode
slide.notes:
1081893 이연림
This video shows CE-EUS in Tissue Harmonic Echo mode. After contrast injection, you can see fine US images of hypoenhanced hepatic lesions. This is performed in low mechanical index and the maximum gain to obtain signals from microbubbles. The contrast enhanced EUS may be useful to delineate and target the lesion for FNA.
slide.notesNormalized:
1081893 이연림
this video shows ce-eus in tissue harmonic echo mode. after contrast injection, you can see fine us images of hypoenhanced hepatic lesions. this is performed in low mechanical index and the maximum gain to obtain signals from microbubbles. the contrast enhanced eus may be useful to delineate and target the lesion for fna.
slide.notesHtml:
1081893 이연림

This video shows CE-EUS in Tissue Harmonic Echo mode. After contrast injection, you can see fine US images of hypoenhanced hepatic lesions. This is performed in low mechanical index and the maximum gain to obtain signals from microbubbles.

The contrast enhanced EUS may be useful to delineate and target the lesion for FNA.
slide.text: CE-EUS in THE Mode

slide.title: Contrast Enhanced EUS-Guided FNA
slide.notes:
1080379 안용식
Hepatic lesions are not clearly defined in EUS. Contrast enhanced EUS reveals multiple hypoenhanced lesions with peripheral enhancement. This is CE-EUS in Tissue Harmonic Echo mode. The lesions are more clearly defined. And the lesion can be well targeted under contrast enhancement.

slide.title: Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma
slide.notes:
712806 고금순
After cytohistologic evaluation, cholangiocarcinoma was finally diagnosed.

712806 고금순

slide.text: Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma Cytologic analysis, Papanicolaou stain On-site analysis, Diff-Quick (Giemsa stain) Histologic analysis, H&E stain

slide.title: Summary
slide.text: Summary DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL EUS-guided FNA for hepatic lesions can be performed safely with high diagnostic performance and limited adverse events. EUS-FNA has limitation for the right lobe lesions. Contrast-enhanced EUS may be useful for delineating and targeting the lesion during FNA.
